fields.title: Automotive: Getting into Gear to Drive Conversions
highlights: 26% increase in build and price conversions as compared to previous year

content.value: Goal
To increase the number of test drives booked and build and price actions on the website by 10%.
Challenge

When it came to audience creation, the client had significant amounts of data at its fingertips. Finding new ways to leverage that data in response to increasing digital competition was where the challenge lay.
EQ’s solution

With the wealth of audience data already available, we wanted to take full advantage. We combined the target customer personas provided, as well as their first-party customer data, and used it to create 34 separate audience segments.

To make sure we had the most high-impact, high-intent audiences possible, we accentuated the segments with our Location Behaviour data. Using this data, we were able to specifically target members of our audiences who had attended the auto show within the last 120 days, visited the Client’s dealerships within the past 30 days, or had visited a competing dealership within the past 30 days (a conquested audience).

Two sets of creatives were provided by the brand for us to execute. The first was a dynamic ad that showcased the most popular vehicles. Clicks were tracked and retargeted with the second sets of creatives, encouraging the viewer to book a test drive or to build and price the model they had expressed interest in.
Targeting was continuously optimized throughout the course of the campaign.
Outcome

The initial campaign was set to run for six months, and was renewed for another six. EQ’s efforts resulted in an 18% increase in test drives in the first six months, which then increased to 30% by the end of the second six-month period. The campaign also resulted in a 26% increase from the previous year of of build and price conversions.
The client says

To be honest, we hadn’t gone into the campaign expecting to obtain much more than we had in previous campaigns. We had severely underestimated the impact of behavioural targeting – a very pleasant surprise! Extremely impressed with the results and looking forward to seeing what more we can achieve in the next campaigns.

fields.description: To increase the number of test drives booked and build and price actions on the website by 10%.

fields.title: Student Recruitment: Achieving Unprecedented Levels
highlights: Strategy resulted in a staggering 8,620% increase in applications YoY
University extended contract term by 3 years with a 40% higher budget

content.value: The client
Leading Canadian University
Goal
To increase applications and enrolment by 300% across 45 different programs university-wide.
Challenge
Competition amongst universities looking to attract new students has never been higher, and there is increasing pressure to show strong ROI from advertising campaigns.
EQ’s solution

The University had the advantage of a full-blown CRM system that tracked the student lifecycle from start to finish – from research and consideration to graduation. For maximum results, we integrated our capabilities into their existing system. To be able to track our efforts and attribute results directly to the campaign, we tagged each advertisement with UTM parameters and placed our retargeting pixels on over 50 landing pages created for the campaign.
Over 50 landing pages were created to meet the needs of the campaign, which was separated into three separate sub-campaigns, each representing a phase of the recruitment lifecycle –
Recruit
Accept
, and
Choose

Audiences were created based on existing personas obtained from the University, with continuous optimization based on where traction was found. Ads were served on a carefully curated whitelist to ensure relevancy in traffic, extending to programmatic, Facebook, search, and even Twitter.
Outcome

66,000 visits were generated to the landing pages, of which 1,462 were converted into leads – a 22% visitor to lead conversion. Out of these leads, 50% were generated in just two months (October and November). 46% intended to begin their university education in the following fall, and 24% the year after. The careful targeting and whitelist curation generated quality applicants, with an average GPA of 81%. 56% of all applicants received offers of admission, and 24% of those with offers accepted.
Next steps

The success of the campaign resulted in a 3-year extension of the University’s partnership with EQ, with a 40% increase in budget. The University will now be extending EQ’s efforts to pursue both international student applications and pathways marketing to promote transfer to the institution.
The client says

The results we’ve experienced working with EQ have far exceeded our expectations! Their insights have translated into the highest digital recruitment rates we’ve ever had, and thanks to that success we now have a much bigger budget allocated to our digital team.

fields.description: To increase applications and enrolment by 300% across 45 different programs university-wide.

fields.title: GeoSpatial Cohorts Enable Equal or Better Efficacy Than 1-to-1 Targeting
highlights: Findings from 500M impressions over 6 months show 3x growth in win-rate and improved eCPC efficiency

content.value: Background

Increased scrutiny on privacy has led to industry initiatives to remove identifiers (3P Cookies and DeviceIDs) from the bidstream, causing a need for privacy forward adtech solutions to segment audiences while maintaining privacy
Challenge

Marketers need an at scale alternative to 3rd party cookies, the IDFA and other 
individual identifiers that allows them to aggregate together audiences for behavioural 
targeting.
EQ’s Solution

EQ Works has been preparing for the scaled identity crisis for the past several years. Taking 
several geospatial data sets from market leading providers, as well as 2 years of EQ visitation data, 
allows for EQ to transfer one to one deviceID based audiences to geospatial cohorts, removing the 
need for an identifier to be present in the bidstream to match an audience.

These geospatial cohorts aggregate together areas that have high propensities or concentrations of the target audience into 
a heatmap that can be activated upon within Atom to reach those users while maintaining privacy at scale.
Results

Moving from one to one targeting on identity to geo-based audiences seems to have negating effects. While the CTRs and Engagement rates drop slightly, the expansion into identity free impression opportunities substantially raises the win rates and lowers the eCPMs, resulting in little change to the eCPCs.
CPM’s with similar bids decreased just over 8%. While there was a minor drop in engagement rate, the CPM decrease leads to slightly lower eCPCs

fields.description: Marketers need an at scale alternative to 3rd party cookies, the IDFA and other individual identifiers that allows them to aggregate together audiences for behavioural targeting.
